verses.plain: Then said the LORD unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind could not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.

tokens.t: Then said the
unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me,
my mind
not
toward this people: cast
out of my sight, and let them go forth.

verses.plain: And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the LORD; Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for the captivity, to the captivity.

tokens.t: And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the
; Such as
for death, to death; and such as
for the sword, to the sword; and such as
for the famine, to the famine; and such as
for the captivity, to the captivity.

verses.plain: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the LORD: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and destroy.

tokens.t: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the
: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and destroy.

verses.plain: And I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.

tokens.t: And I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for
which he did in Jerusalem.

verses.plain: For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest?

tokens.t: For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest?

verses.plain: Thou hast forsaken me, saith the LORD, thou art gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.

tokens.t: Thou hast forsaken me, saith the
, thou art gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.

verses.plain: And I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave them of children, I will destroy my people, since they return not from their ways.

tokens.t: And I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave
of children, I will destroy my people,
they return not from their ways.

verses.plain: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas: I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday: I have caused him to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors upon the city.

tokens.t: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas: I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday: I have caused
to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors upon the city.

verses.plain: She that hath borne seven languisheth: she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day: she hath been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the LORD.

tokens.t: She that hath borne seven languisheth: she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while
yet day: she hath been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the

verses.plain: ¶ Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent on usury, nor men have lent to me on usury; yet every one of them doth curse me.

tokens.t: ¶ Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent on usury, nor men have lent to me on usury;
every one of them doth curse me.

verses.plain: The LORD said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee well in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.

tokens.t: The
said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee
in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.

verses.plain: Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?

tokens.t: Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?

verses.plain: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give to the spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.

tokens.t: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give to the spoil without price, and
for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.

verses.plain: And I will make thee to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not: for a fire is kindled in mine anger, which shall burn upon you.

tokens.t: And I will make
to pass with thine enemies into a land
thou knowest not: for a fire is kindled in mine anger,
shall burn upon you.

verses.plain: ¶ O LORD, thou knowest: remember me, and visit me, and revenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.

tokens.t: ¶ O
, thou knowest: remember me, and visit me, and revenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.

verses.plain: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart: for I am called by thy name, O LORD God of hosts.

tokens.t: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart: for I am called by thy name, O
God of hosts.

verses.plain: I sat not in the assembly of the mockers, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand: for thou hast filled me with indignation.

tokens.t: I sat not in the assembly of the mockers, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand: for thou hast filled me with indignation.

verses.plain: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth to be healed? wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar, and as waters that fail?

tokens.t: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable,
refuseth to be healed? wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar,
waters
fail?

verses.plain: ¶ Therefore thus saith the LORD, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, and thou shalt stand before me: and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.

tokens.t: ¶ Therefore thus saith the
, If thou return, then will I bring thee again,
thou shalt stand before me: and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.

verses.plain: And I will make thee unto this people a fenced brasen wall: and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee: for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the LORD.

tokens.t: And I will make thee unto this people a fenced brasen wall: and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee: for I
with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the

verses.plain: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.

tokens.t: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.

footnotes.text: cause…: Heb. give them for a removing
the mother…: or, the mother city a young man spoiling, etc, or, the mother and the young men
cause…: or, intreat the enemy for thee
I am…: Heb. thy name is called upon me
